an6.21:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying among the Sakyans near the little village of Sāma, by a lotus pond.
an6.21:4.2: Then, late at night, a beautiful god, lighting up the entire lotus pond, went up to the Buddha,
an6.21:5.1: “Sir, three qualities lead to the decline of a mendicant.
an6.21:5.4: These three things lead to the decline of a mendicant.”
an6.21:5.7: Then that god, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.
an6.21:6.1: Then, when the night had passed, the Buddha told the mendicants all that had happened.
an6.21:6.11: It’s unfortunate for those of you who even the gods know are declining in wholesome qualities.
an6.21:7.1: I will teach you three more qualities that lead to decline.
an6.21:7.2: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
an6.21:7.5: “And what, mendicants, are three qualities that lead to decline?
an6.21:7.6: Enjoyment of company, being hard to correct, and having bad friends.
an6.21:7.7: These three qualities lead to decline.
an6.21:8.1: Whether in the past, future and present, all those who decline in wholesome qualities do so because of these six qualities.”
